artist: Artist: Wenceslaus Hollar; Artist: After a follower of Hans Holbein the Younger
creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: Jesus on balcony with two other men in upper center; small crowd in foreground; man R of center in priestly clothing holding out his arms; man at L holds a crucifix
inscription:
Inscription

inscribed in plate at bottom: [His Crosse a Cardinall and Bishop beare, / And why? they Crucifie him everie where / The Popes Crown\'s gold, and Crosse before him borne, / Christe\'s Crosse is, wood, his Crowne a Crowne of thorne] 

numbered in plate at lower right: [10]
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Ecce Homo, From the Satirical Passion
